definitions: decorative artwork displayed behind altar in churches, typically painted or carved
examples: The medieval altarpiece depicted scenes from Christ's life
They restored the wooden altarpiece to its original golden splendor

definitions: act of changing something from its original state or form
adjustment made to clothing to improve fit or appearance
examples: The building required significant alterations to meet safety codes
Minor alterations to the proposal satisfied all committee members
She took her wedding dress for alterations at the tailor
The alterations to his suit cost fifty dollars extra

definitions: noisy argument or disagreement, typically brief but intense in nature
examples: Security intervened during the altercation between two customers
The verbal altercation quickly escalated into physical confrontation

definitions: continuous action of modifying or adjusting something from original state
examples: The constant altering of plans frustrated the entire team
Altering the recipe improved the final taste significantly

definitions: person designated to substitute for another when needed
different choice or option available as replacement
examples: She served as the alternate for the jury trial
The team captain appointed two alternates for the competition
We need an alternate route during road construction
The alternate proposal received more support from members

definitions: repeated succession between two or more different states or conditions
examples: The alternation between hot and cold weather confused gardeners
Regular alternation of crops prevents soil nutrient depletion

definitions: choice or possibility that exists instead of something else
approach or lifestyle differing from mainstream conventional methods
examples: Public transportation offers an alternative to driving downtown
The committee presented three alternatives for budget allocation
Alternative medicine focuses on natural healing methods
They chose an alternative lifestyle living off the grid

definitions: device in vehicles that converts mechanical energy into electrical current
examples: The mechanic replaced the faulty alternator in her car
A failing alternator causes dim headlights and battery problems

definitions: instrument that measures altitude above sea level or ground surface
examples: The pilot checked the altimeter before beginning descent
Mountaineers rely on altimeters to track their climbing progress

definitions: height of object or point measured from sea level or ground
elevation of geographical features especially mountains above sea level
examples: The plane maintained an altitude of thirty thousand feet
Oxygen becomes scarce at extremely high altitudes
The altitude of Mount Everest exceeds twenty-nine thousand feet
Athletes train at high altitude to improve their endurance

definitions: lowest female singing voice or highest male voice range
person who sings in the alto vocal range
musical instrument pitched in the alto range
examples: The alto section harmonized beautifully with the sopranos
His natural alto voice suited the choir perfectly
The choir needs two more altos for balance
She performed as principal alto with the opera company
He plays alto saxophone in the jazz ensemble
The alto flute produces deeper tones than standard flutes

definitions: unselfish concern for welfare of others without expectation of personal reward
examples: Pure altruism motivated her decades of volunteer work
Scientists debate whether true altruism exists in nature

definitions: crystalline compound containing aluminum used in dyeing and medicine
informal term for alumnus or alumna, graduate of specific school
examples: The textile factory uses alum to fix dyes permanently
Alum helps stop minor bleeding from shaving cuts
Several successful alums donated to the university campaign
The alum network provides valuable career connections

definitions: lightweight silvery-white metallic element used extensively in manufacturing and construction
examples: Aluminium foil keeps food fresh in the refrigerator
The aircraft frame uses aluminium for weight reduction

definitions: lightweight silvery-white metallic element used extensively in manufacturing and construction
examples: Aluminum cans are widely recycled across the country
The aluminum siding protects houses from weather damage

definitions: woman who has graduated from particular school, college, or university
examples: The distinguished alumna delivered the commencement speech
She proudly identified herself as an alumna of Harvard

definitions: mixture or blend of different elements forming unified whole
alloy of mercury with other metals used in dental fillings
examples: The novel presents an amalgam of mystery and romance
Their music is an amalgam of various cultural influences
The dentist replaced old amalgam fillings with composite ones
Silver amalgam remains controversial in modern dentistry

definitions: action or process of combining or uniting different elements into one
merger of two or more companies into single business entity
examples: The amalgamation of different cultures enriched the neighborhood
Successful amalgamation requires careful planning and communication
The amalgamation of three banks created the largest financial institution
Shareholders voted to approve the proposed amalgamation

definitions: plant cultivated for edible seeds and colorful leaves, ancient grain crop
deep reddish-purple color resembling the amaranth flower
examples: Ancient Aztecs cultivated amaranth as a staple grain
Amaranth flour provides gluten-free baking options
The sunset painted clouds in shades of amaranth
She chose amaranth fabric for the formal dress

definitions: person who engages in activity for pleasure rather than payment
person lacking professional skill or expertise in particular area
examples: The photography contest welcomes both amateurs and professionals
Many famous athletes began as amateurs in local clubs
His amateur attempts at plumbing caused more problems
Don't dismiss her as an amateur; she's quite talented

definitions: practice or principle of engaging in activity without payment or professional status
examples: Olympic amateurism rules have changed significantly over decades
The club maintains strict amateurism to preserve its tradition

definitions: feeling of great surprise or wonder, often mixed with admiration
examples: Children watched the magic show in complete amazement
To everyone's amazement, she completed the marathon

definitions: mythological female warrior from ancient Greek legends
tall, strong, or athletic woman
world's largest river system in South America
major online retail and technology company
examples: Greek myths describe amazons as fierce warrior women
The amazons allegedly removed one breast for archery
The basketball player stood like an amazon among teammates
She moved with the grace and power of an amazon
The Amazon rainforest produces twenty percent of Earth's oxygen
Expeditions navigate the Amazon river for months
Amazon delivers millions of packages worldwide daily
She ordered the book from Amazon yesterday

definitions: senior diplomat officially representing their country in foreign nation
person who promotes or represents organization, cause, or activity
examples: The ambassador presented credentials to the foreign minister
She served as ambassador to France for four years
Brand ambassadors promote products through social media
He acts as cultural ambassador for indigenous arts

definitions: position or period of service as ambassador to foreign country
examples: His ambassadorship to Japan lasted for five productive years
The Senate confirmed her ambassadorship despite political opposition

definitions: hardened fossilized tree resin often containing preserved insects or plants
warm yellow-orange color resembling the fossilized resin
yellow traffic light signal indicating caution between green and red
examples: The amber contained a perfectly preserved prehistoric mosquito
Collectors value Baltic amber for jewelry making
The autumn leaves turned beautiful shades of amber
She wore an amber necklace matching her dress
The driver accelerated through the amber light dangerously
Stop when the light turns amber unless already committed

definitions: character and atmosphere of place created by surroundings and mood
examples: The restaurant's romantic ambiance attracted many couples
Soft lighting created perfect ambiance for the reception

definitions: character and atmosphere of place created by surroundings and mood
examples: The caf√©'s cozy ambience made it popular with students
Candles and music enhanced the ambience considerably

definitions: quality of being open to multiple interpretations or having uncertain meaning
examples: Legal documents avoid ambiguity through precise language
The ambiguity in her statement confused everyone present

definitions: scope, extent, or bounds of something, especially authority or influence
examples: These decisions fall within the ambit of local government
The investigation expanded beyond its original ambit

definitions: strong desire to achieve success, power, or particular accomplishment
particular goal or aim that person seeks to achieve
examples: Her ambition drove her to work sixteen-hour days
Political ambition motivated his every decision
His ambition to become a doctor required years of study
She achieved her lifelong ambition of climbing Everest

definitions: state of having simultaneous conflicting feelings or attitudes toward something or someone
examples: His ambivalence about the promotion showed in his hesitation
Many voters expressed ambivalence toward both candidates

definitions: food of Greek gods conferring immortality in mythology
sweet dessert made with fruit, marshmallows, and whipped cream
examples: Ancient Greeks believed ambrosia granted eternal life
The gods feasted on ambrosia and nectar
Grandmother's ambrosia recipe includes coconut and oranges
Southern ambrosia remains popular at holiday gatherings

definitions: specially equipped vehicle for transporting sick or injured people to hospital
examples: The ambulance arrived within minutes of the emergency call
Paramedics loaded the patient into the waiting ambulance

definitions: covered walking area, especially around cloister or church
hospital area for patients able to walk rather than bedridden
examples: Monks strolled through the monastery's peaceful ambulatory
The cathedral's ambulatory contains several medieval chapels
The ambulatory care unit handles outpatient procedures
Patients in the ambulatory section require less intensive monitoring

definitions: surprise attack made from concealed position against unsuspecting target
examples: The soldiers walked directly into an enemy ambush
Police set up an ambush to catch the suspects

definitions: act of making something better or less painful, gradual improvement
examples: The new policies led to amelioration of working conditions
Medication provided significant amelioration of her symptoms

definitions: formal change or addition proposed or made to law or document
modification to constitution or legislative bill through formal procedure
examples: The committee proposed several amendments to the policy
The amendment clarified ambiguous language in the contract
The First Amendment protects freedom of speech
Congress ratified the constitutional amendment last year

definitions: useful or desirable feature of building or place
pleasant or agreeable quality that makes place comfortable
examples: The hotel amenities include a pool and fitness center
Basic amenities like running water are often taken for granted
The town lacks the cultural amenities of larger cities
Natural amenities make this region attractive to retirees

definitions: purple or violet variety of quartz used as semiprecious gemstone
examples: Her amethyst ring sparkled in the bright sunlight
Ancient Greeks believed amethyst prevented intoxication

definitions: friend or companion, Spanish word commonly used in informal English
examples: Hey amigo, let's grab lunch together tomorrow
The old amigos reunited after twenty years apart

definitions: friendly relations between people or countries, peaceful harmony
examples: The treaty promoted amity between the neighboring nations
They lived in perfect amity despite their differences

definitions: informal term for ammunition, projectiles and charges for weapons
examples: The soldiers ran low on ammo during the firefight
He stocked up on ammo for hunting season

definitions: colorless gas with pungent smell, compound of nitrogen and hydrogen
aqueous solution of ammonia used for cleaning and household purposes
examples: Ammonia gas can be toxic in high concentrations
Farmers use ammonia as an agricultural fertilizer
She cleaned the windows with diluted ammonia solution
Never mix ammonia with bleach; it creates toxic fumes

definitions: extinct marine mollusk with coiled shell from Mesozoic era
fossilized spiral shell of extinct cephalopod found in sedimentary rocks
examples: Ammonites dominated ancient seas for millions of years
Scientists use ammonite species to date rock layers
The collector found a perfect ammonite in the limestone
This ammonite fossil shows beautiful preservation details

definitions: bullets, shells, and other projectiles fired from weapons
information or arguments used to attack or defend position
examples: The army depot stores tons of military ammunition
Different weapons require specific types of ammunition
The scandal provided ammunition for his political opponents
She gathered ammunition for the upcoming debate

definitions: partial or complete loss of memory due to injury, illness, or psychological trauma
examples: The accident victim suffered from temporary amnesia
Retrograde amnesia erased his memories before the injury

definitions: person suffering from amnesia, unable to remember past events
examples: The amnesiac couldn't remember his own name
Doctors helped the amnesiac reconstruct his identity

definitions: official pardon for people convicted or accused of political offenses
period allowing surrender of illegal items without prosecution
examples: The government declared amnesty for political prisoners
International amnesty allowed exiles to return home
The gun amnesty collected hundreds of illegal weapons
Tax amnesty encouraged payment of overdue taxes

definitions: microscopic single-celled organism that changes shape by extending pseudopods
examples: The amoeba engulfed food particles through its membrane
Students observed living amoebas under the microscope
